item.title: Social immunity and chemical communication in the honeybee: immune-challenged bees enter enforced or self-imposed exile
item.description: We examined the fate of experimentally immune-challenged worker honeybees that had been reintroduced to the hive. We find that they often leave the hive, both by ‘altruistically’ leaving under their own power, and by being dragged out by other workers. Using a chemical transfer experiment, we show that the latter response is mediated by chemicals present on the body surface of immune challenged workers.
